G.T.6052
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 21st OCTOBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
In the attack by the Third Army yesterday north of LE CATEAU the number of prisoners taken was over 3,500.
Further progress has been made on the line north of VALENCIENNES.
East of DENAIN we are in THIANT, HAUCLIN, WAVRECHIN, thence the line runs HAVELUY, WALLERS, MILLANFOSSE, BERTINQUESNE, RUMECIES, (all exclusive), western edge of the BOIS DE FLINES, west of TAINTIGNIES, through WILLEMEAU, east of MARQUAIN, FOURCROIX, PECQ, thence along the canal to HELCHIN, thence north to ST. GENOIS (inclusive), east of SWEVEGNEM, VACHT (inclusive), VIVE ST. ELOI (exclusive), thence north along the river to DEVN?, thence along the CANAL DU LYS to the Dutch Frontier at ELDE?.
We are reported to have crossed the canal at VOSSELERE, and river at GRAMMEN AND PETEGEM.
2. ITALIAN, BALKAN and PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
21st October, 1918.
Issued at 12.45 p.m.
